title: Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request: Body-Worn Camera Footage – Arrest of Dajon Hamlin (September 27, 2024)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request copies of all body-worn camera (BWC) footage related to the arrest of Dajon Hamlin on or about September 27, 2024, by the Glen Ellyn Police Department.

Specifically, I am requesting:

All body-worn camera footage recorded by any Glen Ellyn Police Department personnel during the detention, investigation, or arrest of Dajon Hamlin.

Please include footage captured shortly before, during, and immediately after the incident. As the booking time is listed as 12:00 AM, I request responsive footage from approximately 10:30 PM on September 26, 2024, to 2:30 AM on September 27, 2024.

If any portions of the requested footage are exempt or confidential, please produce the non-exempt portions and cite the specific legal exemptions justifying any withholding or redaction.

I am willing to pay any reasonable fees for duplication and labor but request notification if the costs will exceed $50. Please provide the requested records in an electronic format if possible.

Thank you for your assistance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request: Body-Worn and Dash Camera Footage – Arrest of Nora Fox (October 11, 2024)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (5 ILCS 140/1 et seq.), I respectfully request copies of all body-worn camera (BWC) and vehicle dash camera footage related to the arrest of Nora Fox on or about October 11, 2024, by the Darien Police Department.

Specifically, I am requesting:

All body-worn camera footage recorded by any Darien Police Department personnel during the traffic stop, field sobriety testing, detention, and arrest of Nora Fox.

All dash camera footage from any patrol vehicles involved in the traffic stop, investigation, or arrest.

Please include footage captured shortly before, during, and immediately after the incident. As the booking time is listed as 12:00 AM, I request responsive footage from approximately 10:30 PM on October 10, 2024, to 2:30 AM on October 11, 2024.

If any portions of the requested footage are exempt or confidential, please provide the non-exempt portions and cite the specific legal exemptions justifying any withholding or redaction.

I am willing to pay any reasonable fees for duplication and labor but request notification if the costs will exceed $50. Please provide the requested records in an electronic format if possible.

Thank you for your assistance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act (IPRA) Request: Body-Worn Camera Footage – Arrest of Jose A. Lozoya (February 28, 2025)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act (IPRA), I respectfully request copies of all body-worn camera (BWC) footage related to the arrest of Jose A. Lozoya on or about February 28, 2025, by the Las Cruces Police Department (LCPD).

Specifically, I am requesting:

All body-worn camera footage recorded by any Las Cruces Police Department personnel during the detention, investigation, or arrest of Jose A. Lozoya.

Please include footage captured shortly before, during, and immediately after the incident. As the booking time is listed as 9:35 PM, I request responsive footage from approximately 8:00 PM to 11:30 PM on February 28, 2025.

If any portions of the requested footage are exempt or confidential, please provide the non-exempt portions and cite the specific legal exemptions justifying any withholding or redaction.

I am willing to pay any reasonable fees for duplication and labor but request notification if the costs will exceed $50. Please provide the requested records in an electronic format if possible.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News
